page.title: 03FARMING LAND AT POLWARTH 2
page.content: RENTS REMAINED STSTIC, EVEN BEING DECREASED IN THE 30S DURING THE DEPRESSION. IN THE EARLY 1980S THE WHOLE FARMING ENTERPRISE KNOWN AS MARCHMONT FARMS WHICH FARMS 1400 ACRES THE BULK OF THIS ARES, WAS ENTIRELY REORGANIZED WITH A HEAVY INJECTION OF CAPITAL & TAKING AS MUCH BENEFIT AS POSSIBLE FROM THE E.E.C. GRANTS SYSTEM, PARTICULARLY IN REGARD TO DRAINAGE & FENCING. THERE RE NOW 1100 SHEEP (WITH 1200 & 650 AT THE OTHER FARMS PARTLY IN THE AREA). THEY ARE MOSTLY MULES, BEING BLACK FACE CROSSED WITH BORDER LEICESTER RAMS & THRER IS ALSO A SMALL FLOCK OF BLACK WELSH MOUNTAIN SHEEP WHICH GIVE FINE DARK WOOL. IN ADDITION THERE ARE 25 CONTINENTAL STORE CATTLE.
